item.title: Week notes (2025-W36)
item.description: • Grant-writing, nonstop.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W35)
item.description:
• Grant writing, and emails in support of grant writing.
  • Was partially out of commission this week due to a biking injury.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W34)
item.description:
• Mainly grant-writing and emails in support of grant-writing.
  • Participated in the Surveillance Lab discussion.
  • Participated in a grant-writing educational webinar.
  • Posted about the challenges of accessing and using scholarly metadata pertaining to monographs and grey literature (part of the BibVik project).
  • Mentally preparing for the start of the new semester next week.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W33)
item.description:
• Lots of grant-writing, mainly.
  • Also lots of emails in support of grant-writing.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W32)
item.description:
• Working on the code system.
  • Grant-writing.
  • Scheduling additional interviews.
  • Surveillance Lab meeting.
  • Grant-writing webinar.
  • Working on the ICF paper.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W31)
item.description:
This was a busy one, and looks like all of August will be packed too.

  • Much work on the project grant
    • Presented progress to the rest of the team
    • Started developing an entity-relationship diagram to arrive at more structured nomenclature
    • Signed up for a grant-writing webinar
    • Initiated parallel work on an NFRF exploration grant submission
  • Held another interview
  • Scheduled another interview
  • Significant progress made on the ICF paper
  • Progress on organizing the code system has been limited, I must admit

  • Hosted the SSLA meeting
  • Checked in regarding MSCA grant
  • Inquired about challenges I face for software I use (qc and grobid)
  • Initiated a TT job application
  • Touched on work for the data-tech-poli-arch workshop in December

item.title: Week notes (2025-W30)
item.description:
• Amalgamating and organizing codes.
  • Working on grant proposals.
  • Journal club discussion.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W29)
item.description:
• Finished open coding for the interviews I’ve done thus far.
  • Started re-arranging the codebook.
  • Wrote an intermittent report, which is basically a series of memos to keep me writing in a thematic way and to keep me on my toes as I code.
  • Worked on the CIHR project grant.

  • Submitted revisions for one paper from my dissertation.
  • Update the preprint for another paper with some more visual flair.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W28)
item.description:
• Coded interviews.
  • Held yet another interview.
  • Participated in Surveillance Lab discussion about AI and publishing.
  • Worked on a CIHR project grant.
  • Worked on the MSCA grant (great progress!).
  • Worked on the ICF/data governance paper (also great progress!).

Overall, a really busy week!

item.title: Week notes (2025-W27)
item.description:
• Finished open coding for the first interview.
  • Held my second interview, began writing memos about it (but no coding yet).
  • Corresponding with additional interview participants, trying to pin down dates and times to meet.
  • Preparing for third interview next week.
  • Work on data governance paper.
  • Initiated work on a new CIHR project grant.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W26)
item.description:
• Completed one interview, and mostly finished open coding.
  • Scheduled additional interviews for the coming weeks.
  • Worked on revisions to an article from my dissertation.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W25)
item.description:
• Scheduled interviews
  • Finalized some interview guides
  • Revisions to a paper deriving from my dissertation

item.title: Week notes (2025-W24)
item.description:
• Revised ethics amendment.
  • Worked on the data governance paper.
  • Worked on grant apps.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W23)
item.description:
• Revising ethics amendment
  • Worked on data governance paper
  • Background reading
  • Some other archaeology-related things

item.title: Week notes (2025-W22)

  • Background reading.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W21)
item.description:
• Still waiting for approval on the ethics ammendment
  • Presented for the surveillance lab and had a great discussion
  • Worked on interview planning and memo-writing
  • Read about other Covid-19 data-sharing and collaborative initiatives

item.title: Week notes (2025-W20)
item.description:
• Ethics amendment under review
  • Developed a couple situational maps
  • Developed some interview guides
  • Made significant progress on the data governance paper

item.title: Week notes (2025-W19)
item.description:
• Worked on the case file and interview guides
  • Wrote a memo about the pivot
  • Posted on my personal blog

item.title: Week notes (2025-W18)
item.description:
This week I was largely focused on revising the research protcol and submitting an ethics amendment for a slight pivot to the overall project. I also co-hosted a focus group among practicum and thesis students regarding accessing data from the CITF databank. Also made some significant progress on this ICF/data governance paper.

It’s been more relaxed now that the term is over, and some of the more lively personalities in the office are away for various reasons. So it’s been really quiet and calm in general.

Some additional developments in the archaeology realm of my life too, but I do not want to conflate those with this work.

item.title: Week notes (2025-W17)
item.description:
• Started revising my research protocol for a potential pivot
  • Participated in the Surveillance Lab journal club
